title: Saunderton Circular Walk Route

images.caption: Hillside, Saunderton. A wide grass margin and wheat-field below the edge of Allnutt's Wood.

images.caption: Church of St Mary and St Nicholas, Saunderton

images.title: Andrew Smith / Farmland, Saunderton
images.caption: Farmland, Saunderton. Fields of wheat in the hilly Chiltern landscape. This is the view from the eastern side of Slough Hill. A largely wooded ridge continues to West Wycombe.

images.title: Footpath, Saunderton by Andrew Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Andrew Smith / Pastures, Lacey Green
images.caption: Pastures, Lacey Green This is the rolling landscape just north of Bradenham Wood. Farming become increasingly arable in the valley with Bledlow Ridge rising beyond.

images.title: Steve Daniels / Chinnor from Chinnor Hill
images.caption: Chinnor from Chinnor Hill

images.title: Andrew Smith / Farmland, Bledlow Ridge
images.caption: Farmland, Bledlow Ridge. Steeper grassland gives way to arable fields in the wide valley at Saunderton. Loosley Row is on the opposite hillside.

description: This Buckinghamshire based village is well served by a series of footpaths running into the glorious rolling Chilterns countryside. This figure of eight loop walk takes you to some of the walking highlights of the area. The route starts from the train station and first heads south to visit the National Trust's West Wycombe Park where there's lakes, parkland and gardens surrounding a historic mansion. You then turn north to explore the expansive Bradenham Woods where you'll find miles of peaceful woodland walks. The northern section of the loop takes you to the woodland and viewpoints at Chinnor Hill which lies a few miles north west of the settlement. In this area you can pick up The Ridgeway National Trail. The final section visits the neighbouring village of Bledlow Ridge which lies just a mile west of the train station.
